Blog.post: * It's post modern It's after the war with all that Vintage wine and cheese On your bedroom floor I'm getting tired of discussing the poetry of your second act I switch on the TV 'cause I can't stand to look at you Mmmmmh. * Your Momma don't know and your daddy don't get it I'm up on this stage singing don't you forget it Don't touch me I'm a live wire, And I'll be sining htis song Till these lines grow tired! Hello. J'Ã©tais malade dimanche soir, Ã§a va, Ã§a n'a pas durÃ© toute la nuit. Du coup, Ã§a a Ã©tÃ© une trÃ¨s bonne excuse pour pas bosser... Je sens qu'une catastrophe dans ce domaine va bientÃ´t arriver. Il faut VRIAMENT que je m'y mette si je veux pouvoir partir en Angleterre en toute tranquilitÃ©, sachant que CÃ©lia vient dans deux semaines. Pouyou. Pauv' Colza, apparemment pas sortie aujourd'hui alors que j'avais prÃ©venu T que je ne pourrais pas venir et lui ai demandÃ© s'il pouvait la sortir. Je suis passÃ©e vers 17h30, on a fait un minuscule tour, elle Ã©tait toute contente...

* I have no money, but I can be cute and I can be funny If you just grant me the time of you I will change and I'll be looking to be Oh, every season, every reason to belong And I will stay for long enough Till I have my song Till I have my song If you're wondering, all these lyrics and titles are from Common Rotation songs. Click on the link, right there! J'ai enfin reÃ§u cette p***** de carte bleue de la poste. Par contre, bien sÃ»r, ils ne se sont pas empressÃ©s de me rÃ©pondre les cons. Du coup, j'ai dÃ©pensÃ© de sosus. Plein de sous. Paaaas bien. Oh, et puis merde, hier c'Ã©tait mon anniversaire. Na!

* 'Well the world's asleep in a crimson flush, Standing down the barrel of a gun The one I lush is up with a silent crush On everything under the sun' I'm 24. :D P pulled me out of the bed this morning, she called at 8. Good for me. The cats haven't done anything yet, maybe they're making plans for a surprise party? Toujours pas de carte bleue Par contre, P m'a laissÃ© un K7 vidÃ©o chez Colza avec le clip de Dido et le makin-of du clip. David Boreanaz reste toujours aussi sexy ce con! MÃªme mal fringuÃ©, mÃªme avec les cheveux quasi longs, mÃªme avec la ch'tite moustache. AAarg! Funny, witty, tall, handsome. Aaarg!

* Pass that girl, 'cause she doesn't seem to mind Pass that what's in your hand, 'cause we all need to kill some time Better get drunk quick, 'cause our ride is leaving soon And maybe on the judgement day, I won't be in the room! Hello J'ai le regard de Clem sur moi; il essaye de s'endormir... Mais guette quand-mÃªme une Ã©ventuelle pitance, reste de mon repas. Trop tard Loulou, c'est fini! Toujours pas de carte bleue. SNCF toujours pas rÃ©pondu. LaPoste se refile mon mail de service en service. . Toutes les Amerloques pas rÃ©pondu. Je dois avoir le syndrome HackerGroupie. Et avec tout Ã§a, je sais pas quoi Ã©crire Ã C alors que je lui avais dit que je lui enverrais un mail. Je l'ai mÃªme pas rappelÃ©e. Phase de repos social? Ca semble durer ce truc... Pfff, l'enfermement irrÃ©versible avec les chats guette. Heureusement qu'il y a la miss Colza! Cours qui me rend perplexe cet aprÃ¨s-m... Ca me dÃ©passe vraiment, et pourtant 1/ y'a un bon tas de textes Ã lire et 2/ il reste deux cours de 15 Ã 19h!!! Faudra survivre... Tiens, pour en revenir Ã mon repos social: Ã§a fait pas mal de temps que j'ai plus postÃ© Ã la Barge... J'ai pourtant lu presque tous les messages, et ai eu envie de rÃ©pondre - avec des trucs intelligents en plus, merci les cours! - mais j'ai pas fait l'effort de le faire... Une des explications possibles: les derniers messages que j'ai laissÃ©s n'ont intÃ©ressÃ© personne, pourtant il y avait des remarques ouvertes Ã tout le monde... Bref, I lurk but do not flee. C'est tjrs le maÃ«lstrom sans fin entre Ã©tudes / boulot / thÃ¨se / mÃ©moireDEA / master ESST... Je suis nulle quand il s'agit de faire des choix, c'est chiant. Bon, sur ce c'est bien beau le blog mais faut bosser. Pffff. Un petit tour vers stupidstuff peut-Ãªtre. Mais juste pour retrouver le lien et l'envoyer aux Uhrig :D A propos de site web, c'est tjrs impossible d'effectuer une recherche sur google. Apparemment c'est ce foutu patch de Windows/IE, mais il me semblait que dans ce cas un autre patch correctif Ã©tait Ã©ditÃ© assez rapidement... C'est relativement handicapant quand mÃªme. Allez, ciao.

* Poor boy, you know, you never once fooled me... You put your trust, in the thought that grace was on your side It's such a beautiful day to hide! Coming back from a birthday party... I'm as unsatisfied as usual... But let's go back to yesterday. R , that I haden't seen in ages, had called me to invite me to go to the rugby friday meal and afterwards at the bar. We flirted a bit the first times we met but then I found someone else, he too and he's still with her. It was not the big evening, but I laughed, I had some free beers and even camembert with red wine :). Then it was already late for me but I decided to go to the bar too, have a drink and then go away. L bet that I wouldn't leave before 4am... (I knew I would win for sure, but this is another story) At the bar there were already some other people - among them A : I would like to know him better (like: a frriend) but I've noticed any move toward him misleads him on my intentions... - anyway, this is another another story. And after a good non-alcoholic orange juice, it was 1am so I said goodbyes - but R told me "I'm leaving too" so we went outside together, chatted (?) a bit and when I was ready to leave he asked me for a real kiss. Oh crap. No guy, when you get older (he's 4 years older than me)... 8 Months ago, before Arwen, I guess I would have said yes, tasted it and enjoied it, without thinking too much about any consequences. On the way back home, I put Common Rotation as loud as possible but then I started thinking about M and it was worse! Result: headache this morning Noticeable events: Rugby world cup in Australia: France-Japan 51-27 (or something like that). Their new tight-fitting T-shirts are... tigth-fitting. Very good idea indeed :D. Colza: she was rather nice today and for the first 20 minutes of "lunge-work" (?) she did everything as I was asking, it was perfect. Stop, walk, trot, canter... Yeah! Then I went to the supermarket to spend some money on needed things, like food, and on un-needed things like kitchen gadgets... Cooked a bit, so I brought to A : a tuna cake, an olive and bacon cake, a chocolate cake and a fromage frais salmon terrine. I'm proud for once :) Good food, good drinks, talks with people I've known since high school and others I'd never met before... It was great, but I have to say after a couple of hours those visions of happy couples annoy me a bit. So... I left. And as always, on the way back, Common Rotation thoughts flooding my mind. Tonight at 2:30 am it's 8:30 pm in Long Island, the CoRo gig at the Oyster Fest is over but I so wish I could have been there... I want to be a Common Rotation groupie! I want to go to nearky each of their gigs, like I would go to the swimming-pool once a week, but each time to a different swimming-pool, with various water temperature. I want to be French, live in France and at the same time be able to fly anywhere I want (without any jetlag of course!). I should have picked my favorite band in the local ones, like Weepers Circus for instance: I saw them once some years ago at the FÃªte de la Musique (June, 21st, each year, everywhere in France). Now, they're kinda famous with gigs all around France. But, more important I have to find a solution to my M problem. This is what you get when you don't have the morning talk - or when you don't have any talk, like what happened with N . Well, tomorrow will be short, there's some horse-riding in the countryside with Jim, and some homework. So, here endeth the rant (plus, Buffy on TV!)

* She saved me from a slow process of mental sinking during my first year in Marseille. It has been ages since I've listened to this CD ( When the Pawn... ), and tonight while working I put it in the CD player. It was a strange feeling, because her songs are at the same time gentle with me and they remind me of some difficult memories too. And in the end there's this song... I Know . Listening and singing along to it, I realised something: it made me think about Spike and Buffy. Partly because I miss Buffy (cant' watch DVDs anymore, nothing on TV, no new season to expect) and partly because I had this image stuck in my head, where Buffy sleeps in Spike's arms, after she's been evicted from the Power Slayers... [here you can note how involved I felt in what I was doing...] Take a look at this, changing the point of vision (she he) - here it's Spike speaking, not Fiona: So be it, I'm your crowbar If that's what I am so far Until you get out of this mess And I will pretend That you don't know your sins Until you are ready to confess But all the time, all the time I'll know, I'll know And you can use my skin To bury secrets in And I will settle you down And at my own suggestion, I will ask no questions While I do my thing in the background But all the time, all the time I'll know, I'll know Baby-i can't help you out, while she's still around So for the time being, I'm being patient And amidst the bitterness If you'll just consider this-even if it don't make sense All the time-give it time And when the crowd becomes your burden And you've early closed your curtains I'll wait by the backstage door While you try to find the lines to speak your mind And pry it open, hoping for an encore And if it gets too late, for me to wait For to to find you love me, and tell me so It's ok, don't need to say it. I have found a fairly good french transcription somewhere, if among the no-ones who are reading this there's someone who'd like to read it.

* I'm bored. I want to surf but it seems I can't tonight. No credit card yet, btw. It means I can't book the hotel for SP, I can't book the flights either - so I'm virtually not going yet. Grr, arrg. And I want new "Angel"s!! Wait... I want the complete season 4 first, bien que ce p'tit con de Connor me sorte par les trous de nez... La preuve, j'arrive mÃªme pas Ã revoir la fin de la saison 3!

* Yessss! Ce matin lever difficile mais pour une fois j'ai rÃ©ussi Ã m'activer: mÃ©nage, un peu de lecture, et zou! chez les parents pour passer l'aspiro dans la voiture. Et aprÃ¨s j'ai emmenÃ© ma mÃ¨re m'acheter mon cadeau d'anniversaire :)) Donc Padd, Ã Mundo: des chaps, des vraies, qui tiennent bien chaud, en cuir et avec un petit effet esthÃ©tique dont je me serais bien passÃ©e mais bon, on va pas se plaindre. Et puis aussi un chapeau en cuir, type australien! :D I have an outfit for one Senior Partners party! I'm gonna be a cowboy.. Errr, wait. Cowgirl? But I do get the blues!

* aaargh! J'avais Ã©crit un beau message mÃªme pas trop con, sur ce sentiment que tout devient clair d'un coup en cours alors qu'avant c'Ã©tait la mouise, sur les chats, sur Colza, et y'a eu une merdouille... Pfff, mÃªme pas drÃ´le. Allez, on s'arrache.

* This morning I woke up with Clem sleeping on my shoulder and arm, it was cute. This cat is a doll! Good news: the vet is coming tomorrow morning for Colza! P and I finally managed to worry T enough :)

* Sunny day, nearly warm! I couldn't get up at 8 as I wanted to, because there was a party in the flat above mine all night long and I couldn't sleep... But the cats where hungry, so I had to get up :) During the breakfast, I have watched a doumentary on the USA presidential elections (2000). All the counts, and re-counts, and the purge lists... It is appalling, you wonder where is the democracy there. Also, there's a big problem of lobbying going on, both economical and political. And in the end, George W. Bush appears as a muppet, a very rich muppet though. Strangely enough, I think it was a good way to start the day because then I was ready for the "History of the industrial revolutions" and its economical aspects. Ready until I was hungry, at least. The cats haven't eaten their food yet. There are some cans they choose to dislike some days and they love some other days. Lunatics! The afternoon was horsy. Colza and Tanagra both neighed (?) when they saw me arriving :D. J and S were a bit late but it was OK since Colza had lost the bandage at her foot: I had to remove all the mud from the hole, clean it all again and put a clean gauze. Four mares on a ride can be quite annoying when they all decide at the same time to slow down, eat some grass and go wherever they want. But we had fun, as Colza wasn't limping. Well, apart from when Tanagra fell on her knees and J on her neck so that he was cut at the lips and his teeth where hurting a lot. I have brought back home a saddle-cloth and the cats where crazy with it, smelling and licking Colza's sweat.. Beuh! Horse sweat is said to repel fleas, so I guess it's good for them. Anther paper to read, then it'll be bath and... ER!!! They are showing the "whole new" season 9. I miss Mark Greene a a lot. Hey, I miss Buffy and Angel too! I want them back. And I want Angel at a decent hour, not at 5pm on a Saturday! It's perfect for Dawson's Creek but a disaster for Angel. Mmmm, long post. This will probably be one of the few like that :) I'm not artsy, I'm not folky, I'm not the slightest bit lonely I'm not well-read, I'm not well-put, but theere's something burning in my gut I'm lad at someone, I'm mad at someone Common Rotation 'Did A Verse End?'

* Je vais virer mon ancien blog et son titre intelligemment dÃ©bile (voire l'inverse), mais j'ai juste conservÃ© "le" message qu'il contenait: Tue Jun 03, 08:28:20 PM Day has been quite good in fact. I have managed to get up ar 7:30 am, which is very early for me. I went to where the horses are and had just begun to groom Colza when I received an SMS from Peggy "female foal is born". I ran to sea her and her mother (Leonir). Leonir has still a big belly, and her daughter is beautiful and is in great Shape. These are very good news compared to what happened with Arwen. I miss her a lot. And I wonder if I'll recover one day. One thing for sure is that she has changed me. Well... So I saw this beautiful baby horse and went back to Colza. We went on a 2-hours ride - some parts were a bit scary for her, especially the cows :). She can be as silly as... a horse sometimes, but she's got a big heart. It was beginning to be really hot so I showered her entirely and refreshed myself too. then I had to clean her box, plus two other ones. It took an hour, as they were not too dirty - althgough Colza always manages to make a mess really quickly. I took Colza and her friend, Tanagra to their meadow. On the way, Tanagra was frigthened by a bus and hit me in the jaw with her big head. I didn't think it was serious until this afternoon when I noticed I had a bump and pain all over. X-rays tomorrow morning! The afternoon was quiet, at home, between eating, calling some people, looking for stuff on the Internet and filling in some applications for next year. A woman came to carry out a survey on an ad campaign for a sportstore. I knew nothing about this campaign and never go to this store. Bad for them and, somehow, "I can't seem to care". Dipsy, my cat slept nearly the entire afternoon of course. She's a constant invitation to have a nap. Bad girl!

* P*****, j'ai essayÃ© pendant cinq jour de publier les deux derniÃ¨res entrÃ©es, y'avait toujours un blÃ¨me. AAARg! Et dire que nos Bleux se sont plantÃ© en quart de finale face aux Anglais. * I'm dying I can't go to any of their gigs... And I don't think reading reviews and watching pix is that good for my sanity. Pas une journÃ©e excellente aujourd'hui, mais comme dirait l'autre, c'est lundi. * It still means nothing up here, and less and less people are dressing up. Yeaaaah! Anyway, this was a good occasion to party, and with peeps who don't usually party . And hey, what a surprise, two of them ended up being pissed off - at each other mostly, as it happens nearly each time they go out (that means once or twice a year). Always for the same reasons. Then I was disapointed because the one guy I would have like to meet tonight didn't show up at the club we went to. Man, I was daydreaming about him even while I was dancing on techno music. This daydreaming has intensified lately, this means I'm going to make a mistake. Like being too direct, too fast. Let's say that now I'm perfectly aware of what could happen, it won't. Or later :D

* Two packages in the mail today!!! - Global priority mail : The two kane CDs.. One of them has the jewel case broken but the CD is ok, so the other one will be for my dad - from Germany : Pics from Senior Partners!!! Some are blurred but most of them are good and there are some lovely Steve ones. *g* this is a good surprise, S didn't tell me anything about those :). I hope she'll get my prezzie soon. or, thinking about it, that she'll get it one day. It should be ok, though, 'cause the seller is verified. Haha!!! It's a bit disappointing that the videos are not bigger and haven't a better qality. I should call S. Romanov to ask her for her DV recording ! :D

* and I can't find it here CÃ©lia m'a dit que j'Ã©tais peut-Ãªtre destinÃ©e Ã Ãªtre avec un guitariste amÃ©ricain. Ca fait plaisir d'y croire, mÃªme si ce n'est que pour deux secondes. Au moins pour la mi-juillet, comme Ã§a je corrige aprÃ¨s et je peux partir en vacances en septembre :-) Je ne suis plus super motivÃ©e par le sujet - bon, en plus comme je continue pas lÃ -dessus, j'ai pas envie de faire du zÃ¨le pour un Ã©ventuel "repreneur". Ekin, Mathilde et Archna sont parties, les Uhrig dÃ©mÃ©nagent ce samedi (quelle folie!), le monde change un tout petit peu. Je vais peu Ã peu reprendre ma vie trop tranquille, entre chats et chevaux. * I wanna be ready for what you do... I'd love to spend the money I don't have for a new Fiona Apple album. She finds the right words to touch my messy brain. Well, Clem finds the right purrs, but I can't sing along with him :-) I do like Blogger and it's kindof outsider position, as everyone I know (who blogs) uses LJ... They all should move over here now that the profile and comment features have been added. Seriously. Unwanted lazy day tomorrow again. At noon, I was trying to do some work but felt exhausted and thought I could have a 30-minutes nap. I had it... but I was constantly half-thinking, half-dreaming how bad I was for not working more on my thesis. I don't get it, if I feel so guilty, why don't I manage to be more active? Colza wasn't feeling 100% well today so with GÃ©rard Tanagra we had a calm ride, only walking. Walking is baaaad when your butt hurts from too much horse-riding because it makes it burn even more. Hemm. Welcome to the shiny details of my horse life :-) Talking avout shiny, I got one of my DVD sets of Firely back - I'll be able to watch it again! Yay! Have emails to write, see ya.

* ... says Jeff Buckley. This song kills me with its lyrics and the softness of the guitar parts. Well, and of course Jeff's voice. Today was a positive day: I managed to actually work on my thesis! Past week has been... gray? Some deceiving stuff, some good stuff... Let's not talk about it. Colza was great of course :-) So today I managed to revamp the introduction and the first part of the thesis. I still have to add some corrections and tomorrow I can transcribe the last interview and maybe start the second part. Knowing how I'm functionning, I doubt I'll do both. Received the Love Actually DVD, it's a region 3 one but the DVD player didn't say anything about it. Some extra features don't work, though, grrrrrr! Some I don't mind, but I'd love to watch the deleted scenes. OK, I got it for 8.5 euros, shipping included so I guess the extra features would have made more expensive ;-). I couldn't resist, I watched it with the commentary at lunch time. Colin Firth.... Hight Grant.... Aw. Went to see Colza around 7 pm, as it was beginning to be a little bit cooler. She welcomed me as when she asks for her food, but she had already had eat so it was only a friendly welcome (Re: Almond). She was sweating a bit so I decided to braid her mane (sp?) Ã la spanish, so that she wouldn't be to hot on the neck. She didn't move as I was making it. We got ready and of course she wasn't keen on living the farm - but as soon as we headed to where she thought she'd find her latest crush, Muscat, her pace changed. She wasn't deceived not to find him and we went outside of the village, waved at a stork, passed her haunted house - which is now demolished but she remembers it. We had a fast trot, walked more went up and down some hills and had a nice canter with a little "speedy" part. She didn't go crazy and was being very respectful, doing what I was asking her. With the sun going down and the smell of the freshly cut wheat, it was a dream! Colza, Colza, Colza, I love you! Back home, I parked the car, looked up my balcony and saw Clem meowing at me, then running inside... to wait me at the door. Good little kitty. This was my Monday. Thrilling adventures, heh? Oh, and the highest peak of adrenaline was this morning as I was "doing" my budget and noticed I was already broke, with the phone bill and car insurance still to be paid. Mwahahahahha. Current Mood: calm Current Music: Jeff Buckley - Morning theft

* tooootoroooo! * OÃ¯! I'm in lazy mode so, copy babe! I'm gonna work this out! I just installed Firefox to use instead of IE - and there's a pepper smell in the air, I don't know where it comes from. No link to firefox of course. Anyway, I'm learning to pla with all the cool features on here. I still have to learn about how to detect music. There is indeed a way, but then I have to click on a link which directs me to a blank page. This has been one of those lazy days, when you keep telling yourself "I should be working instead" and you feel bad because you don't do anything serious. I set the alarm clock at 8 am and couldn't get up before 8:45. Then I went on the Internet, "just to check emails" and ended up staying online for more than an hour. The only good thing I did today was going to Lampertheim and have quality time with Colza. I prepared all the stuff I can't name to ride her (saddle, bit and brushes?). Then I opened the cupboard and thought !i should clean a bit the "horse-care section". I found creams and drugs dating back to 1990!!! I had to throw away 90% of what I found, including expensive stuff. Well, I knew Colza's owner is terrible when it comes to tyding up, cleaning and keeping track of what he has.... But there I had the impression I was carrying out some archaelogical (sp?) research. Funny thing, when I was checking and cleaning all this stuff, at first colza was eating, minding her own business. But then she must have remembered curiosity is part of her species so she peeked out of her "room" and started looking at what I was doing, even sniffing here and there. Well, knowing her, I can tell she was looking for more food, but I still have the fantasy of being friends with my horse :-) This took me nearly one hour, then Colza and I could eventuallly leave and have a 1h30 ride. Perfect weather for this : good, but not too warm. Earth and grass in perfect condition to ride too. I think she even liked it - apples are beginning to fall on the ground and she detects them miles away so she even had her sweets. Her feet and back were OK, I'm relieved I haven't "broken" her again. Don't know what to do now to start working on the second aprt of my thesis. I suck at concentrating on sthg else than leisure. Note to Almond : if you still feel creative, I need new curtains :-) Current Music: White Stripes - Cold Cold Night ----- Later... ----- deepest sender songwriter Yay! Detect Music works! You can't imagine how happy I am now. Current Music: The White Stripes - The Air Near My Fingers
* It seems like I won't have the DSL connexion before 2 weeks, so I'm gonna be out of the loop for a while. See ya!

* Yep, because, well, I'm lazy. And I'm a master of the copy shortcuts :-) August 3rd, 2004 04:49 pm - *mgrfvrvvsss* This afternoon I was so tired I went on the couch and fell asleep right away. I heard the phone ringing for a text message, tried to move my hand but I was completely out. Now I feel sick, with that odd taste in the mouth. Beh! That's what I get when I sleep with tempartures too hot and two cats at my side. Dipsy hates the fish "croquettes" and keeps coming to me to ask for something else, and meows like she wonders how I can pretend I dnon't understand her. Can't work on the thesis. Too hot.... Current Mood: ditzy - Current Music: - unionmaid August 1st, 2004 10:56 pm - aaah, dear parents :-) * My parents are going on vacation for 12 days, good for them. But they have asked me, as parents ask, to do house-, cat- and plants-sitting while they're away. It means going to their house twice a day and spending quite some time there in the evening, 'giving water' to the plants and grass. I'd be OK to do it if I was myself on vacations, but the fact is I'M NOT! And they don't understand this at all. It's summertime, every student is on vacation, I don't go to an office from 8 to 5 SO I'm on vacation. Three of our neighbours have offered to do all this stuff (and we did that some ten years ago) but now, it's better I take my car to go there twice a day, blablabla. Anyway. I'm so upset about them not wondering what's my position in all this I'm starting to get a bad feeling about my ability to concentrate next week. I think I'm gonna ask one of the neighbours to feed the cat and "open" the house in the mornings, so that I'll do the evening stuff. Argh. D'autres trucs chiant mais je vais me rÃ©frÃ©ner. P****n, les trucs comme Ã§a arrivent toujours tous en mÃªme temps. Ca va encore faire une super nuit de sommeil Ã§a je le sens bien! Suis allÃ©e voir Colza ce soir, elle semblait presque m'attendre :-))). Et elle est mÃªme sortie de son box toute seule, sans que j'aie Ã la tirer comme un bourrin; aprÃ¨s pour aller vers la carirÃ¨re elle me suivais sans problÃ¨me. Colza je t'aime!
